snippet: More than 100 people were wounded in an attack that the Turkish prime minister suggested had been plotted by the Islamic State.
abstract: Suicide bomber strikes cultural center in Suruc, Turkey, near Syrian border, raising concerns that Islamic State is bringing violence from war in Syria to country; at least 30 are killed and more than 100 wounded in blast.

byline.original: By KARAM SHOUMALI and CEYLAN YEGINSU
byline.contributor: Karam Shoumali reported from Istanbul, and Ceylan Yeginsu from Mugla, Turkey. Maher Samaan contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: More than 100 people were wounded in an attack that the Turkish prime minister suggested had been plotted by the Islamic State.

headline.main: Turkey Says Suicide Bombing Kills at Least 30 in Suruc, Near Syria
headline.print_headline: Suicide Bomber Kills at Least 30 in Turkish Town Near Syria

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
